p: Another type of myositis that does not concern skeletal muscle is myocarditis (i.e., inflammation of the myocardium). Indeed, arboviruses such as CHIKV, ZIKV, and DENV can provoke myocarditis in some cases [ 49, 50, 51, 52]. In a large scale pediatric study in Colombia, among 102 DENV infected patients, 11 of them (10.7%) presented myocarditis with one fatal case [ 53], and in a study conducted in China, the prevalence of myocarditis in hospitalized confirmed dengue patients reached 11.28% (201 out of 1782 patients) [ 54].
